newsitem.title: JAPAN: Germany's KfW launches 5.55% yen/A$ samurai bonds.
newsitem.headline: Germany's KfW launches 5.55% yen/A$ samurai bonds.

text.p: Germany's Kreditanstalt fuer Wiederaufbau (KfW) on Tuesday launched 20 billion yen worth of 5.55 percent yen/Australian dollar dual currency samurai bonds due on November 1999, lead manager Nikko Securities said.
The bonds will be priced at par, with twice yearly coupon payments. The coupon will be paid in yen, while redemption will be in Australian dollars.
Holders of the samurai bonds will receive A$5,562.04 for each 500,000 yen bond held at maturity.
The breakdown of the terms is as follows:
AMT 20 bln yen COUPON 5.55 pct MATURITY Nov 8, 1999
TYPE dual samurai ISS PRICE 100 yen PAY DATE Nov 8, 1996
NOTES: Syndicate members are Nikko Securities, Daiwa
Securities, Nomura Securities and Yamaichi Securities
